alert.note: Alert for Little River; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 12:50AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Sevier, western Little River, eastern McCurtain, northwestern Marion, Franklin, Bowie, Upshur, Titus, northern Smith, western Cass, Wood, Morris, Camp, northwestern Gregg and southeastern Red River Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1249 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hagansport to near Lake Fork Reservoir to near Van. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, Mount Pleasant, De Queen, White Oak, Gladewater, Gilmer, New Boston, Mineola, Pittsburg, Winnsboro, Horatio, Foreman, Boxelder, Leesburg, Lindale, Mount Vernon, Daingerfield, Quitman, Hughes Springs and De Kalb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
